Dear Ms. Dore:
Attached is the Original Licensing Study Report for the above referenced facility. The
study has determined substantial compliance with applicable licensing statutes and
administrative rules. Therefore, an original license is issued.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 552-3662.
Sincerely,
Mark R. Hunter, Licensing Consultant

II. METHODOLOGY
08/27/2021 Enrollment
11/19/2021 Inspection completed onsite.
III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
The facility is a one-story business office style building. There are numerous rooms
that provide versatility in how they may be used. There are more than enough
rooms to provide office space for staff, visitation areas for children and families,
supplies storage, clerical areas, small group meeting areas, and adequate record
maintenance and retention. There is also a plan for expansion into an additional
area of the building as needed to meet the needs for any program expansion. There
is locked storage for files and a cross shredder for documents containing CHRI.
B. Program Description
The agency application is to provide adoption, foster care, and treatment foster care
services. A summary overview description of the program is as follows:
1. Children in the programs:
a. Range in age from birth to 21 years of age.
b. All children are served by Ennis Center no matter their race, color,
national origin, religion, creed, age, sex, disability, marital status, sexual
orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, genetic information, military
status or economic background.
c. The majority of children served are emotionally compromised from the
trauma of abuse and neglect.
2. Provider homes are needed:
a. With a wide range of knowledge to meet the varying needs of the
children and in accordance with the services Ennis Center provides.
b. To provide care for infants, small children, and teen mothers.
c. That are interested in providing quality care to:
i. Children with a variety of behaviors including those with more
difficult behaviors.
ii. Those with special needs.
iii. Large sib groups.
iv. Adolescents.
d. These families must demonstrate:
i. Emotional stability.
ii. Good child-rearing practices.
iii. Patience, understanding and warmth.
iv. The capacity to provide for the individual needs of each foster
youth.
2

3. Providers participate as full partners of a professional team servicing children
and their families.
a. Providers must be able to meet the guidelines of the State of Michigan
for foster parenting.
b. Ennis Center providers must be willing to cooperate with agency staff
and other professionals to maximize the growth and development of
children in their care.
4. Ennis Center for Children not only services families in Genesee, Livingston,
Monroe, Oakland, Saginaw, St. Clair, and Wayne Counties but also in
surrounding counties.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
There are no violations.
IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend issuance of a original license to this child placing agency, private.
11/29/2021
